result.execSummary:
The defendant Barbara M. Bremer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Work release/huber in the event of revocation.  Counsel stipulate to 1 day credit in the event of revocation.

Conditions:

Submit to AODA and follow through with all recommendations.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any educational or other programming ordered by the agent.

Pay costs of supervision, court costs having been paid already out of the posted bond in this case.  1 set of costs ordered for this case.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
No costs imposed on this count.
Concurrent with: Count 2

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Barbara M. Bremer
Current: 221 E School St, Belleville, WI 53508 United States  (Effective: 09-19-2017)
Prior: 17132 Main St., Richland Center, WI 53581 United States

Defendant Barbara M. Bremer in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA informs the Court parties have reached an agreement for resolution calling for dismissal/read in of counts 1 and 4, amendment of count 2 to possession of THC, and pleas then to counts 2, 3, and 5.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.  

Sentence:  Count 2 - 6 months jail, imposed/stayed for 2 years probation with conditions of AODA and follow through as well as attendance/payment/completion of educational/other programs ordered by agent; pay costs; submit DNA sample at RCSD.  Count 3 - 6 months jail consecutive, imposed/stayed for probation with the same conditions.  Count 5 - 9 months jail concurrent with counts 2 and 3, imposed and stayed with same conditions.  Credit in the event of revocation:  counsel stipulate to 1 day.

Court imposes 1 set of costs.
Status conference on August 31, 2016 at 09:00 am.
